thread.title: MetLife Cuts Compensation for CEO, CFO in Year Beset by Snafus

author: Leslie Scism
title: MetLife Cuts Compensation for CEO, CFO in Year Beset by Snafus
text:
Total compensation for MetLife Inc.’s chief executive fell 3.6% last year, after the firm’s management team spent recent months fixing problems in a retirement-services business that failed to pay thousands of people owed pension benefits.
CEO Steven A. Kandarian received total compensation valued at $14.7 million, down from $15.3 million in 2016, according to the New York company’s newly released proxy filing. The company’s chief financial officer, John C.R. Hele, received 6.4% less in total compensation, at $5.3 million...
